qas.question: During which years did the execution of the Boston martyrs take place?
Which group was responsible for the deaths of the Boston martyrs?
What goal is cited as the reason these killings took place?
What rival group did the Anglican Puritans want purged from their area?
Which two groups viewed the Puritans themselves as nothing more than heresy?
Who was executed in the 16th entury?
Who held political and religious control of the American colonies?
What where the Quakers trying to achieve in the colonies?

plausible_answers.text: Eastern Orthodox and Oriental Orthodox communions

qas.question: What communions also considered the Quakers heretical?

context: Another example of the persecution of heretics under Protestant rule was the execution of <b5_0>the Boston martyrs<b5_0/> in <a0_0>1659, 1660, and 1661<a0_0/>. These executions resulted from the actions of the <a1_0><b6_0>Anglican Puritans<b6_0/><a1_0/>, who at that time wielded political as well as ecclesiastic control in the Massachusetts Bay Colony. At the time, the colony leaders were apparently hoping to achieve their vision of <b7_0>a "<a2_0>purer absolute theocracy<a2_0/>"<b7_0/> within their colony .[citation needed] As such, they perceived the teachings and practices of the rival <a3_0>Quaker sect<a3_0/> as heretical, even to the point where laws were passed and executions were performed with the aim of ridding their colony of such perceived "heresies".[citation needed] It should be noticed that the <a4_0><b8_0>Eastern Orthodox and Oriental Orthodox<a4_0/> communions<b8_0/> generally regard the Puritans themselves as having been heterodox or heretical.
